content: porter square hat designed by sophie veksler a comfy simple hat that knits up quickly and will become a winter staple choose from double brim or fold up brim and two adult sizes becausesophie ​ sophknitsalot - share pictures of your finished object with #portersquarehat ​ ​ ​ ​ for personal use only pattern information finished dimensions sizes adult small adult large will fit a 20-22 23-25 inch head height with brim folded 8 5 9 inches width unstretched flat 7 8 inches brim 3 5 inches folded or double brim 7 inches unfolded gauge 4 x 4 = 18sts x 26 row in stockinette hat is stretchy so gauge is not critical for this project yarn loops and threads impeccable solids or any aran weight yarn mc green - 80 100 yards cc white - 60 75 yards notions - crochet hook double brim version only - scrap yarn double brim version only - stitch markers 7 - one for bor 6 for decreases - tapestry needle needles suggested us 8 - 5 0mm 16 40cm circular knitting needles and/or dpns an extra 16 inch circular needle approximately the same size double brim version only to put stitches from provisional cast on onto abbreviations bor - beginning of round k - knit k2tog - knit 2 together p - purl p2tog - purl 2 together pm - place marker ssk - slip slip knit slipped sts together mc - main color cc - contrast color sts - stitches * * - repeat instructions between asterisks 1 directions for double brim version 1 provisionally cast on 72 84 stitches with cc https //www youtube com/watch v=3ogg0aij3xe join in the round making ​ ​ sure your stitches aren t twisted pm for bor 2 *k2 p2* until work measures 4 inches from cast on edge approx 22 rounds 3 join mc *k2 p2* for 3 rounds note you do not need to cut cc you can just carry it up the back as it ll be hidden on the inside of the double brim 4 pick up cc *k2 p2* for 2 rounds note you do not need to cut mc you can just carry it up the back as it ll be hidden on the inside of the double brim 5 repeat step 3 then cut mc leaving a tail 6 pick up cc *k2 p2* for until work measures 7 inches from cast on edge approx 5 more rounds 7 carefully remove provisional cast on and place live stitches onto a separate needle 8 fold brim up into the inside of the hat so that the two circular needles are parallel line up the stitches so that they are even with each other before proceeding to the next step close any gaps left where you switched colors by weaving in the ends for a few stitches using a tapestry needle don t worry about weaving in the ends fully as they ll be hidden after the next step 9
